intro: Filago crocidion, commonly known as the narrow-leaved filago, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in grassland habitats. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by bracts that persist into the winter. Filago crocidion is a hardy perennial that is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
